body_html:
Hello,

Here is the filled template:

OS Platform and Distribution : Windows 10

TensorFlow installed from : Conda

TensorFlow version : 1.11

Bazel version: NA

CUDA/cuDNN version : CUDA v10 / CUDNN v7.3.1

GPU model and memory : Geforce 1060 6B Max-Q

Exact command to reproduce :
-Microsoft Visual studio 2017 installation : C++ complier box checked
-CUDA 10 installation : all ok , version is good
-CUDNN version for CUDA 10 . .dll placed in the bin of NVIDIA Toolkits/CUDA/v10/bin
-pip install tensorflow-gpu
And it still doesn't see my GPU
I clicked on "repair" in Microsoft Visual Studio 2017 to try but it still doesn't see it.
When i do nvidia-smi in the Windows command , it says either it doesn't work or my GPU isn't in WDDM mode. I don't understand that...

I also tried to install cuda and cudnn via "conda -c install tensorflow-gpu" in the conda prompt , it installed automatically cuda toolkit v9 directly and cudnn version accordingly (so , without installing manually CUDA) in the python libraries but not in C:\Program... and not in the environment variable . But it still doesn't work.

I tried to install CUDA v9 manually but the installation said that my system is incompatible as my gpu muight be newer than the version of CUDA (which is surprising) , and therefore I could not use CUDA fully.

Mobile device: NA
body_text:
Hello,
Here is the filled template:
OS Platform and Distribution : Windows 10
TensorFlow installed from : Conda
TensorFlow version :    1.11
Bazel version: NA
CUDA/cuDNN version : CUDA  v10 / CUDNN v7.3.1
GPU model and memory : Geforce 1060 6B Max-Q
Exact command to reproduce :
-Microsoft Visual studio 2017 installation : C++ complier box checked
-CUDA 10 installation : all ok , version is good
-CUDNN version for CUDA 10 . .dll placed in the bin of NVIDIA Toolkits/CUDA/v10/bin
-pip install tensorflow-gpu
And it still doesn't see my GPU
I clicked on "repair" in Microsoft Visual Studio 2017 to try but it still doesn't see it.
When i do nvidia-smi in the Windows command , it says either it doesn't work or my GPU isn't in WDDM mode. I don't understand that...
I also tried to install cuda and cudnn via     "conda -c install tensorflow-gpu"   in the conda prompt , it installed  automatically cuda toolkit v9 directly and cudnn version accordingly (so , without installing manually CUDA) in the python libraries but not in C:\Program... and not in the environment variable  . But it still doesn't work.
I tried to install CUDA v9 manually but the installation said that my system is incompatible as my gpu muight be newer than the version of CUDA (which is surprising) , and therefore I could not use CUDA fully.
Mobile device: NA
body:
Hello,

Here is the filled template:

OS Platform and Distribution : Windows 10

TensorFlow installed from : Conda

TensorFlow version :    1.11

Bazel version: NA

CUDA/cuDNN version : CUDA  v10 / CUDNN v7.3.1

GPU model and memory : Geforce 1060 6B Max-Q

Exact command to reproduce : 
-Microsoft Visual studio 2017 installation : C++ complier box checked
-CUDA 10 installation : all ok , version is good
-CUDNN version for CUDA 10 . .dll placed in the bin of NVIDIA Toolkits/CUDA/v10/bin
-pip install tensorflow-gpu
And it still doesn't see my GPU
I clicked on "repair" in Microsoft Visual Studio 2017 to try but it still doesn't see it.
When i do nvidia-smi in the Windows command , it says either it doesn't work or my GPU isn't in WDDM mode. I don't understand that...

I also tried to install cuda and cudnn via     "conda -c install tensorflow-gpu"   in the conda prompt , it installed  automatically cuda toolkit v9 directly and cudnn version accordingly (so , without installing manually CUDA) in the python libraries but not in C:\Program... and not in the environment variable  . But it still doesn't work.

I tried to install CUDA v9 manually but the installation said that my system is incompatible as my gpu muight be newer than the version of CUDA (which is surprising) , and therefore I could not use CUDA fully.

Mobile device: NA
